instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Hey Rossmann Team,

I have a Problem with 820-00244-A Logicboard.
I dindt have any sign of life. no current on USB-Ports.
So i decided to change the U3100.
Now i have a low current. (0.025A) for few seconds and then 0,0.

Cause the missing PPBUS_G3H i changed U7000

but it doesnt make any difference.

P_IN:           5,19V
SMC_RST_IN:    0 V
VDDA/P:          5 V
 SMC_RST:  0.6 V
A/BMON:    0V

Thanks

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Remove F7040 and check C7043 voltage.

Do you get 3V3_G3H at least?

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
I did. = 0V

sadly no Voltage on 3V3_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you try known good USB flex?

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
The USB Flex is new, the old was brocken.
Sadly no. 
A B2B customer sended it. I dont like when other guys worked on the Mainboard but the data is important.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Input voltage can't switch to 20V without 3V3_G3H.
SMC must talk with CD3215 chip and this voltage is required.
Post its diode mode to ground reading.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: you need all readings ? from U3100 ?

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: [ATTACH type="full"]61324[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: I meant 3V3_G3H reading to ground, in diode mode.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Well at least you have all diode readings of the U3100 now.
3V3_G3H have 360

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Yeah, but I prefer to get the readings on the interesting lines; instead of looking of that screenshot.
Like the LDOs lines of U3100, for example.

You've posted some signals and voltage for U7000, but we need more; ACIN, VR_AON, ACOK, LDO_3/5P0.
If any missing, check it in diode mode too.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
ACIN:  5.19V
VR_AON:  3V
ACOK: 0V   390
LDO_3:  3V
LDO_5: 5V

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
"ACIN:  5.19V"
Looks like R7011 is bad; change it.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: i have 1.23 V now. Maybe i measured wrong, cause C7022 has 5.19V. Whatever. Is there a list for what Voltages are important and what voltage i need ?

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at 3V3R3V0_AON; compare with good board.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: The line is good  i have 3V

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Having 3V there doesn't assure all is good.
Lower diode mode reading than expected, may be caused by a bad component in that line.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
okee the problem is i dont have good board to compare. What is the right value?
What about my missing 3V3 ? will a bad component in tzhat line cause this too ?

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-00244[/URL]

3V3_G3H is generated by U7000.
The chip may bad, or has bad solders.Just in case, check/replace R6990 and R/C6994.
Be sure all traces are good.

threads.title: 820-00244-A no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
I thinked of that and replaced U7000.
I will make it tomorrow.
Sadly my customer will wait only until tomorrow i hope it will work.
